Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery vessel, the fabric is partially grey in section, the interior is spotted with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior (now very worn) is covered with a brown slip and faint traces of at least three lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Curator's comments: To be published by J. Cromwell
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393285) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393285)
